div.p: Multiple terms entered into a single field are treated as boolean ANDs.

div.head: Fuzzy Searching
div.p: The default search type is fuzzy - the user can select from the similarity dropdown list, or take the default value, 90%. Selecting a lower percentage will increase the number of results returned, because the search engine will count 'fuzzier' or less exact matches as hits.

div.head: Wildcard/Stemming
div.p: If the user enters a term with a wildcard, the term will be searched as a wildcard query. To perform a single character wildcard search use the "?" symbol. To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the "*" symbol. The single character wildcard search looks for terms that match that with the single character replaced. For example, to search for "text" or "test" you can use the search: te?t
Multiple character wildcard searches looks for 0 or more characters. For example, to search for test, tests or tester, you can use the search: test*
You can also use the wildcard searches in the middle of a term: te*t But, you cannot use a * or ? symbol as the first character of a search.

div.head: Combined Searches
div.p: A user may enter a term with a wildcard AND a term without into a single search field; these will be treated as separate queries (the term with operators as a wildcard query, and the one without as a "fuzzy" search).

div.head: Search Results
div.p: Users may refine a result set by selecting a semantic qualifier (names, persons, places, institutions, semantic tags, image metadata). Once selected, this term is added to the query as a boolean AND.
Filters may be removed by clicking the 'remove' link next to a filter.

div.head: Browse
div.p: Users may browse the controlled vocabularies for two keyword types: semantic tags, and image descriptors.
